hackathon-description-text: WNY Civic Hackathon is an initiative to bring developers from WNY to come and work on an application and/or a software product to help WNY potentially grow. The topics in focus for the event are civic themed including: Housing & Blight, Transportation and Public Policy & Advocacy.
hackathon-requirements:
All teams are encouraged to submit their hack. At least one team member should be present in order to give a demo on Sunday for the hack to be presented.
Demos of your hack include but are not restricted to: Live Demos, Presentations, Code.
Hack Submissions should be straightforward and easy to understand.

Each demo should be not more than 300 seconds (5 minutes). Presenters will be told ahead of time and will be told how much time remains during the presentation.
hackathon-rules:
All participants are expected to sign-up on eventbrite.
All teams are encouraged to submit their hack. At least one team member should be present in order to give a demo on Sunday for the hack to be presented.
Demos of your hack include but are not restricted to: Live Demos, Presentations, Code.
Hack Submissions should be straightforward and easy to understand.

Each demo should be not more than 300 seconds (5 minutes). Presenters will be told ahead of time and will be told how much time remains during the presentation.
Prizes are given for first, second and third place. (Would be distributed among your team members)
There will be experiential prizes for each category: Housing & Blight, Transportation, Advocacy & Public policy
Our hackathon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, previous hackday attendance or computing experience (or lack of any of the aforementioned). We do not tolerate harassment of hackathon participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate at any hackathon venue, including hacks, talks, workshops, parties, social media and other online media. Hackathon participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the hackathon without a refund (if applicable) at the discretion of the hackathon organisers.
hackathon-description-header: Create something cool in your very own Western New York!
